snippet: House Speaker John A. Boehner asked to exclude other leaders, leaving it to him and President Obama to reach an agreement.
abstract: Congressional aides say that, at House Speaker John A Boehner's request, Senate leaders and House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi have been excluded from talks to avert a fiscal crisis, leaving it to Boehner and Pres Obama to find a deal; all sides, even parties excluded, say clearing negotiating room improves chance for success.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and PETER BAKER

lead_paragraph: House Speaker John A. Boehner asked to exclude other leaders, leaving it to him and President Obama to reach an agreement.

headline.seo: At Boehner’s Request, He and Obama Negotiate Alone
headline.main: In Talks on a Budget Deal, Boehner and Obama Stand Alone
headline.print_headline: Participants in Talks on a Budget Deal Shrink to Two: Obama and Boehner
